page.title: 07WALSALL MARKET
page.content: Dating from{C12}with a{Royal Charter, {Walsall Market}winds down a hill between the shops from{St Matthews {Church}to the town centre. It is an {open air}market with canvas covered stalls which sell almost everything. Open on Monday,Tuesdays,Fridays and Saturdays,it is noisy and crowded with a superb atmosphere, as the friendly stall holders shout their wares in all kinds of weather. There are over{100 {stalls,}and many have been in the same family for centuries. Most stall holders are{Midlanders}but a few come from as far as{London}and{Burnley. They arrive at 6.30am,start trading at 8.00am and finish at 5.00pm.Customers come from the local area and on the day we surveyed,visitors had come from {Australia}and the{U.S.A.}It is not certain whether the new supermarket development will affect market trade.
